Quality is good, it's adorable and flattering and would be so fun with jeans and would stand out. I'm hourglass shaped and usually need tops that show my waist so I don't look like SpongeBob, but this was so cute I didn't care if it wasn't flattering because it was so cute. But I couldn't make it work. Bummer.
This top is very comfortable and thin material so I was not hot at all. I put a black lace long sleeve underneath and it was perfect!

Fair quality and awesome style. Well made. Not designer quality but passes. I couldn’t stop wearing it. Leopard was the “it” pattern for spring. Next spring who knows. But if I have to thrift it I won’t feel guilty if I spent $200 on a designer piece.

This shirt is cute but I’m not going to keep it. I bought it for a possible contender to make myself a clown costume. I wanted to wear it with the ties in the back. This shirt can’t really be worn that way with how the neck is made, it sits too high on your throat if you wear it backwards.  The sleeves were a nice length and the shoulders were puffier than I thought they’d be, but it was cute overall. I didn’t really like where the waist sat, it was cute but I’d prefer it to be a bit higher. The shirt is made out of cotton but it was sort of thick, it hid my black bra well. Overall it’s a really cute shirt and I’d possibly consider keeping it but I usually only wear dresses and the color black so getting used to a white shirt would be a big thing for me! Also besides these cute little bloomers I have on in the photo I wouldn’t know what to pair it with! I’m not big on pants.
